title: Tom Brady roasts Logan Paul, calls wrestler’s athletic abilities ‘cute’
author: Khari A. Thompson
bullets: Tom Brady mocked Logan Paul's athletic abilities during a chat on Paul's 'IMPAULSIVE' podcast ahead of the Fanatics Flag Football Classic.
Brady said Paul's athleticism is not on par with NFL stars like Saquon Barkley, Justin Jefferson, or Odell Beckham Jr.
The Fanatics Flag Football Classic will feature NFL stars and is scheduled for March 21 in Riyadh, Saudi Arabia.

title: Massachusetts emergency room wait times rank among the longest in the U.S.
author: Annie Jonas
bullets: Massachusetts ranks third in the U.S. for emergency room wait times, with an average of 189 minutes per visit.
Major contributors to long wait times include capacity issues and staffing shortages, affecting emergency departments' efficiency.
The percentage of visits lasting over 12 hours has increased, with 39% involving mental health crises by 2024.

title: Report: Retired 5x Pro Bowl left-tackle offers to help train Will Campbell
author: Khari A. Thompson
bullets: Terron Armstead offered to help train Patriots' Will Campbell this offseason after his Super Bowl struggles.
Campbell faced criticism for his Super Bowl performance, with concerns about his technique and physical limitations.
Armstead, a retired five-time Pro Bowl tackle, believes Campbell's issues can be fixed with proper technique training.

title: More than 400 readers voted: $240K in-office Boston job or $120K remote?
author: Autumn Sloboda
bullets: 56% of over 400 readers preferred a $240,000 in-person job in Boston over a $120,000 remote role, while 40% chose the remote option.
Many who opted for the $120,000 remote job cited flexibility, time savings, and reduced commuting stress as key benefits.
Respondents favoring the $240,000 in-person job highlighted the higher salary's impact on financial security and a preference for in-office interactions.

title: City councilor calls for restrictions on e-bikes and mopeds, including ban for food delivery drivers
author: Ross Cristantiello
bullets: Councilor Ed Flynn proposes restrictions on e-bikes and mopeds due to safety concerns, including a ban for food delivery drivers.
New measures could require e-bike riders to have a driver's license, register vehicles, and adhere to traffic rules.
DoorDash opposes proposed ban, citing economic impact and potential increase in car deliveries, leading to more pollution.

title: Video shows corrections officers brawling in elevator at Boston jail
author: Beth Treffeisen
bullets: Three correctional officers brawled in an elevator at Suffolk County House of Correction on Saturday morning.
The fight involved a spilled coffee and two officers trying to intervene, resulting in a scuffle on the elevator floor.
The Suffolk County Sheriff’s Department is investigating and promises appropriate disciplinary actions based on the findings.

title: Asparagus could soon become Massachusetts’ official state vegetable
author: Katelyn Umholtz
bullets: Bill proposed by Rep. Homar Gomez and Sen. Jo Comerford to name asparagus as Massachusetts' official state vegetable.
Asparagus, known as 'Hadley grass,' historically was a significant crop in Hadley, producing 80% of the nation's supply.
The proposal is in a statehouse committee, with hopes for a public hearing including local students advocating for the vegetable.

title: Paula Cole wants to spend Valentine’s Day with you
author: Lauren Daley
bullets: Paula Cole to perform a Valentine's Day concert at Groton Hill Music Center, Groton, Massachusetts.
Cole's 'This Fire: 30' tour begins in September, celebrating the 30th anniversary of 'This Fire'.
She plans to release a 64-track archival box set, 'Sonic Memoir', showcasing unreleased tracks from 1989 to 1996.

title: Boston meteorologists say Monday’s storm is ‘trending toward a miss’
author: John Waller
bullets: Meteorologists report Monday's storm is likely to miss Boston, tracking south and east, moving offshore.
Some coastal flurries expected today, but mostly dry and seasonal weather predicted for the upcoming holiday weekend.
Temperatures expected to rise into the 40s next week with a milder weather pattern developing in the region.

title: 5 best new restaurant openings and dining updates in Boston (Feb. 12, 2026)
author: Katelyn Umholtz
bullets: Citrus & Salt to open second location in Burlington with a patio and private dining in Summer 2026.
Moro Mou to combine Greek and Japanese cuisines at a 15-seat omakase spot in Seaport, opening Summer 2026.
The Down Low offers a cocktail experience in Woburn with live entertainment and Detroit-style pizza, now open.
